title: Stuck at checkpoint sync no peers
body:
Trying to sync archive node in ethereum mainnet , been almost a day stuck at checkpoint sync retrieving bootstrap peers=0. I guess this is because of Internal CL added in v2.3.0 , is this normal that checkpoint sync takes this long? 
command=/usr/local/bin/erigon --datadir=/home/erigon/mainnet --private.api.addr=0.0.0.0:8090 --metrics --metrics.addr 0.0.0.0 --torrent.download.rate=512mb
![erigon](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44673414/204301235-8a7bdcd2-54f9-43a6-9afa-87e6da0b407d.png)

I experience the same phenomenon.

OS: Ubuntu 20.04
Erigon version: v.2.30.0 running Docker with the standard settings (except port forwarding)

**Expected behavior**
Lightclient finds peers and retrieves bootstrap.

**Actual Behavior**
Lightclient does not find peers and does not retrieve bootstrap
`erigon-downloader-1` finds peers, downloads snapshots, then halts at 100.00% 247.4GB/247.4GB.

Logs after restarting containers:

This issue is stale because it has been open for 40 days with no activity. Remove stale label or comment, or this will be closed in 7 days.
This issue was closed because it has been stalled for 7 days with no activity.

I resolved the issue for myself. 

Short: The ports were not exposed to the Internet.

Long: My server is located in an eduroam network. eduroam is a DMZ, so ports might be open at the server but not exposed to the Internet due to the eduroam firewall. In my case, I resolved the issue by getting in contact with the eduroam admins. They opened the relevant ports for Erigon and Lighthouse (ports: `30303`, `9000`; protocols: TCP, TCP6). Make sure to let the admins open the ports for your external IP address: `wget -qO- ifconfig.me/ip`
